title: meeting recurrence patterns
body: calendar functionality does not allow for specifying end date for meeting or appointment. Bring back reccurrence from wm 6.5 where you could create complex meeting schedules

comments.body: Not only does the calendar on Windows Phone not allow for specifying a range of recurrence for meetings or appointments, it does not allow for recurrence patterns with any more nuance than "Once, Every Day, Every Weekday, Every <current day of week>, Day <current day of month> of every Month, Every <current day of current month>".  The phone needs to be able to have as much nuance in the recurrence pattern as does Outlook.  Otherwise, recurrence patterns get majorly messed up when displayed on the Windows Phone calendar:  Events that are set to occur every 4 years in Outlook occur every 1 year in Windows Phone and events that occur on an alternate calendar in Outlook occur on the numerical equivelant Gregorian date in Windows Phone.  For example, an event set to Heshvan 2 on the Hebrew Lunar Calendar in Outlook displays as February 2 on Windows Phone (Heshvan is the 2nd month of the Hebrew calendar and occurs in the autumn, not the winter).  These flaws need to be fixed for Windows Phone to be taken seriously.
